statement.tex: %text If \[ x^y = e^{x-y}\], then show that \[\qquad \frac{dy}{dx} = \frac{\log x}{\lbrace \log (x\cdot e) \rbrace^2}\] %
\\ x^y = e^{x-y}\implies y\cdot\log x = x - y \\ %text \underline\text{What operation must be done} for the above to be true? %
\\ %text Given that \[ y\cdot \log x = x-y \], will $\frac{dy}{dx}$ evaluate to the following? %
\\ %text Is the \underline\text{following line of reasoning correct}? %

options.tex: %text Take logarithm to the \underline\text{base $e$} on both sides %
